meanings.definition: To treat or process (used or waste materials) so as to make suitable for reuse.
meanings.sent1: I recycle my old newspapers by turning them into new paper products.
meanings.sent2: We should recycle plastic bottles to help protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: Why did the bicycle refuse to recycle? It was tired of being used over and over!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity allowed her to recycle ideas into fresh concepts.
meanings.sent5: The artist's ability to recycle materials into beautiful sculptures was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: To undergo reuse or renewal; be subject to or suitable for further use, activity, etc.
meanings.sent1: The glass jars can easily recycle into decorative candle holders.
meanings.sent2: Old clothes can be recycled into new outfits with a bit of creativity.
meanings.sent3: Why did the clock decide to recycle? It wanted to turn back time!
meanings.sent4: His passion for music allowed him to recycle old tunes into modern hits.
meanings.sent5: The community's efforts to recycle waste into energy were commendable.
